page.title: 14The fisherman's hotel.
page.content: The River Eden flows past Wetheral. Because it has always been one of the great salmon rivers of Britain and because this is a very good stretch of water the Eden has been important in the growth of the Crown Hotel.At the abbey nearby monks controlled all the salmon fishing on the River Eden for many hundreds of years. 300 years ago the Crown was a farm but even then, so many many fishermen stayed there that it was more profitable to turn it into an hotel. The fishermen had a special room where they could talk and re-tell their fishy stories. there was also a room in which they could store their tackle and clean the fish.Even after extensive modernation the modern Crown Hotel has retained a room which is called the Fish Room.
